text: North Korea competed as the Democratic People's Republic of Korea at the 1972 Winter Olympics in Sapporo, Japan. ==Speed skating== ;Women {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan=2|Event !rowspan=2|Athlete !colspan=2|Race |- !Time !Rank |- |500 m |Tak In-Suk |align=center|55.80 (fall) |align=center|28 |- |rowspan=3|1000 m |Choi Dong-Ok |align=center|1"36.67 |align=center|27 |- |Tak In-Suk |align=center|1:35.38 |align=center|20 |- |Han Pil-Hwa |align=center|1:33.79 |align=center|12 |- |rowspan=3|1500 m |Kim Myung-Ja |align=center|2:32.55 |align=center|29 |- |Han Pil-Hwa |align=center|2:25.64 |align=center|13 |- |Kim Bok-Soon |align=center|2:25.48 |align=center|12 |- |rowspan=3|3000 m |Kim Ok-Soon |align=center|5:09.69 |align=center|13 |- |Kim Bok-Soon |align=center|5:07.93 |align=center|11 |- |Han Pil-Hwa |align=center|5:07.24 |align=center|9 |} ==References== *Official Olympic Reports * Olympic Winter Games 1972, full results by sports-reference.com Korea, North 1972 Category:1972 in North Korean sport
